<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">"But we neednt have been to all that trouble," she <add hand="ms"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-lucy" key="Swithin, Lucy">Lucy</rs></add></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">continued "making the Barn ready, for it didnt rain this</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">year"</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">"This year, last year, next year, never..." muttered</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">old <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-bart" key="Oliver, Bartholomew">Bartholomew</rs>. "Tinker, tailor, soldier, sailor..." He was</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">talking in his sleep.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Lucy slipped her letter into its envelop<add hand="ms" place="inline">e</add>. It was time</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to read her boo<add hand="ms" place="inline">k</add>---the <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-outl" key="Outline of History, The">Outline of History</rs>. She had lost her</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">place. She looked at the pictures; mammoths and mastodons,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and prehistoric birds. Then she found the page where she</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">had stopped.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The darkness had 
            <choice>
              <sic>incrased</sic>
              <corr>increased</corr>
            </choice>, and it was cold. With a little</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">shiver, Mrs Swithin drew her sequin 
            <choice>
              <sic>sha<add hand="ms" place="above">w</add>lw</sic>
              <corr>shawl</corr>
            </choice> about hew shoulders</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">She was too deep in the story to ask for the window to be</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">shut. <quote source="#" rend="inline">"London"</quote> said the author "<quote source="#" rend="inline">
            <choice>
              <sic>a s</sic>
              <corr>was</corr>
            </choice> then a swamp...</quote></l>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="inline">
            <l>Thick groves of trees covered the land, and on the top</l>
            <l>oftheir matted branches, birds sang..."</l>
          </quote>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The great square of the window showed only sky now.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It was <add hand="ms" place="above">a <!-- come back to this --></add> losing its light; it was <del hand="ms">svere</del> <add hand="ms" place="above">severe</add> <del hand="ms">and</del> stone xxxxx</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">blue. The shadow crept over Bartholomews face. He looked</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">leafless, spectral. As a dog shudders its skin, his skin</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">shuddered. He rose, shook himself, glared at nothing,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and stalked from the room. They hard the <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-sohr">dog's</rs> paws padding</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">on the carpet behind him.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Lucy turned the page quickly, guiltily,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">like a <add hand="ms" place="inline">c</add>hild who will be told to go to bed before it 
            <choice>
              <sic>raches</sic>
              <corr>reaches</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the end of the chapter. Pre-historic man, she read, half</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">human, half monster, rose from his semi-crouching position</l>
